intro: Diapedium cochabambense, commonly known as the Cochabamba diapedium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
